name: Micro Entertainment: Peggy
description:
This game is part of the Micro Entertainment Pack, a collection of tiny desktop games I developed for fun.

Click or drag pegs to move them, placing them according to the rules of Peg solitaire: a peg is moved 2 places in any orthogonal direction if it landing in a blank place and the place it passes over has a peg inside. The peg passed over is removed. The goal is to clear the board of all but one remaining peg which sits in the special highlighted goal place.

  • Classic Peg solitaire gameplay, with seven different layouts., including the most popular English and European (French) layouts.
  • An additional triangular mode, where pegs are arranged in a hexagonal grid and can be moved in any of six directions.
  • Unlimited undo to help you crack those harder puzzles.
  • Tiny, unobtrusive graphics and Micro Mode - The game only occupies a fraction of your screen real estate, and can even be displayed in half size on high DPI displays, making it perfect for discreetly playing at work or while watching something on your computer.

Currently I prioritise mac binaries, as that's the only platform I play these games on, but am also building for other platforms (they will be up in February). They are written in Rust and have a dependency on C libraries SDL2 and SDL_gfx.
